term: automatic functioning mode during the cooking period
original_definition: 'automatic functioning mode during the cooking period' means a condition in which the air flow of the range hood during the cooking period is automatically controlled through sensor(s), including as regards humidity, temperature, etc.;
generated_definition: 'automatic functioning mode during the cooking period' means one minute after motor and lighting switch off, product switches automatically into modes and conditions as referred to in previous point.

Article 2: ‘automatic functioning mode during the cooking period’ means a condition in which the air flow of the range hood during the cooking period is automatically controlled through sensor(s), including as regards humidity, temperature, etc.;

‘automatic functioning mode during the cooking period’ means a condition in which the air flow of therange hood during the cooking period is automatically controlled through sensor(s), including as regards humidity, temperature, etc.;
Article 8: For range hoods with automatic functioning mode during the cooking period and fully automatic range hoods, the delay time after which the product switches automatically into the modes and conditions as referred to in the previous point shall be one minute after the motor and lighting have both been switched off either automatically or manually.

Forrange hoods withautomatic functioning mode during the cooking periodandfully automatic range hoods, the delay time after which the product switches automatically into the modes and conditions as referred to in the previous point shall be one minute after the motor and lighting have both been switched off either automatically or manually.
